adjectives.description: infectious (comparative more infectious, superlative most infectious)

entries.meaning: (pathology, of an illness) Caused by an agent that enters the host's body (such as a bacterium, virus, parasite, or prion); often, also, transmitted among hosts via any of various routes (for example, contact, droplet-borne, airborne, waterborne, foodborne, fomite-borne, or bloodborne).
examples: More infectious diseases like the flu are usually less potent.

entries.meaning: (pathology, of a person) Able to infect others.
examples: Despite feeling better, the patient is still infectious.

entries.meaning: (of feelings and behaviour) Spreading quickly from one person to another.
examples: Her enthusiasm for work can be really infectious.

entries.meaning: (informal) Memorable and invoking excitement or interest.
examples: Pop music is more infectious than elevator music.
